titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Enlightenment Society collection ARCH103
titlestmt.author: Sean Parke

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Hartford Archives & Special Collections

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-06-15 11:41:48 -0400.

repository.corpname: University of Hartford Archives & Special Collections

did.abstract: The collection contains the records and printed ephemera of The Enlightenment Society which was an organization of alumni, parents, and friends whose membership provided financial support for the University of Hartford.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection may be protected by copyright law (U.S. Code: Title 17). Any use of the material which exceeds fair use requires permission from the copyright holder. Researchers are solely responsible for obtaining the proper permission(s) for their use of the material.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Enlightenment Society was an organization of alumni, parents, and friends whose membership provided financial support for the University of Hartford. Membership required annual donations and membership levels were determined by the size of the donation. Plaques were given to all members (see Russell Ahlquist plaque in box 2).

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: In 2015, the call number was changed from T to ARCH103. It appears that the Enlightenment Society materials were originally part of a larger collection consisting of many different organizations (entitled "University Associations, Ancillary Activities, and Auxiliary Groups"). At the time it was reprocessed in the fall of 2015, the collection consisted of just the University of Hartford Associates Collection (ARCH102) and the Enlightenment Society Collection. These were split into two collections. The collection was reprocessed in 2015 by Tiffany Crawford and Sean Parke. During reprocessing, the materials were transferred to new folders and boxes, but the order and file names were retained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists primarily of documents pertaining to some of their annual dinners in the 1970s including invitations, memorandums, clippings, and speeches. The collection also includes pamphlets, photographs, and Russell Ahlquist's plaque.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection consists of six files in their original order.

did.unittitle: Van Atta, Gerald and Smith Robert E. photographs

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Russell W. Ahlquist's daughter, Beverly Harris, donated her father's plaque to the University's Institutional Advancement office to give to the Archives in Dec. 2014.
